snippet: The Nicolaigarden school in Stockholm tries to free girls and boys from traditional gender roles, starting with replacing “him” or “her” with “friend.”
abstract: Stockholm Journal; preschool in Stockholm known as Nicolaigarden is attempting to avoid gender stereotypes, and even prohibits gender-specific pronouns; advocates praise school for its effort to blur gender lines and cement opportunities for both men and women but critics say issue of gender equality in Sweden has gone too far.
lead_paragraph: The Nicolaigarden school in Stockholm tries to free girls and boys from traditional gender roles, starting with replacing “him” or “her” with “friend.”

headline.main: Swedish School’s Big Lesson Begins With Dropping Personal Pronouns
headline.print_headline: A School’s Big Lesson Begins With Dropping Personal Pronouns
